image.altText: An older gentleman with a grey mustache and black vest holds a framed photo of a young man while sitting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has become the last state to pass a "long and overdue safety reform" that allows both corporations and individuals to be charged for negligence or breach of duty when it causes a death at work has passed both houses of Tasmania's parliament.

title.children: 'People haven't died in vain': Grieving father's relief as industrial manslaughter laws pass in Tasmania

image.altText: Michelle Rowland stands in a Parliament House courtyard wearing red.

props.synopsis: Proposed laws set to be introduced to parliament on Thursday would grant Australia's media watchdog greater powers to force tech companies to crack down on misinformation and disinformation.

title.children: Social media companies could be fined for not cracking down on misinformation under new bill

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit with a suspension bridge behind him.

props.synopsis: Former Launceston mayor and current councillor Danny Gibson has been asked to step down after claims he sexted with a school theatre student, and other unwanted sexual advances towards young men.

title.children: Launceston mayor asks councillor to resign in 'best interests' of community in wake of historical allegations of unwanted sexual advances

image.altText: an upset woman cries out the front of a courthouse

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button was behind the wheel of a bus returning from a wedding when it flipped on a roundabout, killing 10 passengers and injuring 25 others.

title.children: Families surprised by bus driver's 32-year sentence for killing their loved ones

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff told a News Corp editor that the ACT's former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold "wrought evil" and was "eager to lie to jail a man who may be innocent," court documents have revealed.

title.children: 'This is insanity': Court documents reveal texts and emails between Lehrmann inquiry chair and News Corp journalists

image.altText: Kamala Harris after the debate

props.synopsis: The stakes were higher for Democrat candidate Kamala Harris in the US presidential debate: she has a tougher audience to win over than Republican Donald Trump does.

title.children: Harris had one mission in the debate — to reach middle Americans better than Trump could

image.altText: A man in a bright orange hazmat suit stand next to a piece of machinery unloading chemicals.

props.synopsis: Australia's leading advocate on Parkinson's disease is calling for a ban on a widely-used chemical because of growing evidence about the risk to farmers.

title.children: Parkinson's Australia calls for ban on widely-used chemical paraquat over risk to farmers

image.altText: Woman with long black hair sitting on green chair behind desk with microphone.

props.synopsis: A training licence application by Tasmania's top harness racing trainer was approved after eight days, despite an active investigation into allegations of race fixing, team driving and animal welfare concerns.

title.children: Racing Minister Jane Howlett defends decision allowing harness trainer to compete again despite race fixing and animal welfare claims

image.altText: A police officer detaining someone

props.synopsis: Capsicum spray has been used by police and protesters have been detained as demonstrations outside the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Center escalate. Follow live.

title.children: Police pepper spray protesters at massive rally against defence expo

image.altText: A man in puffer jacket and beaning holding up an electric car V2L cord.

props.synopsis: A reverse charging feature on his electric vehicle allows Mr Yong to power his fridge, charge his family's devices and even run his smart bike during blackouts.

title.children: This electric car feature was a 'lifesaver' for these Tasmanians in a widespread power outage

image.altText: A collage of three musicians

props.synopsis: Fortnight is nominated in nine different categories at the MTV Video Music Awards, while Olivia Rodrigo, Chappell Roan, Charli XCX, Eminem and *NSYNC are also up for awards.

title.children: See the MTV VMA nominees, from Taylor Swift & Post Malone to [checks notes] Taylor Swift & Post Malone

image.altText: Two men wearing suits conversing next to a train

props.synopsis: The US and UK's chief foreign affairs advisors visit Ukraine to discuss the country's military needs in its fight against Russia.

title.children: Top US, UK diplomats make rare joint visit to Kyiv as Ukraine appeals for right to fire long-range missiles into Russia

image.altText: A man with short hair and a suit walks solemnly near a courthouse

props.synopsis: The MP has been awarded $140,000 after a Federal Court judge found a tweet posted by former One Nation NSW leader Mark Latham was defamatory.

title.children: Sydney MP Alex Greenwich awarded $140,000 after suing Mark Latham

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: David Speirs says he's taking time away from work to concentrate on his health days after a video — which appears to depict him snorting from a plate — emerges. He has previously strenuously denied wrongdoing, reportedly telling News Corp the video is a deepfake.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader takes medical leave two days after 'deepfake' snorting video emerges

image.altText: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi wears a graduation cap and a keffiyeh and holds a bunch of pink flowers while standing on a roadside.

props.synopsis: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi's family called for an independent investigation into her death after the Israel Defense Forces released its preliminary findings.

title.children: Biden seeks 'full accountability' from Israel over shooting of American activist in West Bank

image.altText: A man is silhouetted against a video screen with an Facebook logo as he poses with a smartphone

props.synopsis: Facebook has admitted that it scrapes the public photos, posts and other data of Australian adult users to train its AI models and provides no opt-out option, even though it allows people in the European Union to refuse consent.

title.children: Facebook admits to scraping every Australian adult user's public photos and posts to train AI, with no opt-out option

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The judge chairing an inquiry into an English hospital in which infant serial killer Lucy Letby worked tells a hearing anyone doubting the former nurse's guilt is causing her victims' families "enormous additional distress".

title.children: Lucy Letby was convicted of killing seven British babies. A judge has a warning for those who think she's innocent

image.altText: Prescription medicines

props.synopsis: Here’s what a review of assessment processes for medicines and vaccines suggested could be done to reduce PBS listing wait times.

title.children: New medicines could be PBS-listed in just four weeks if a 'visionary' proposal is adopted

image.altText: Eight people wearing high-vis gear stand outside a plane.

props.synopsis: Two Delta Air Lines planes collide on a taxiway at Atlanta's airport, with a larger plane knocking off the tail section of a smaller regional jet.

title.children: Tail section knocked off Delta plane during collision at US airport

image.altText: Collage of photos Muriel McKay, the kidnapper (above) and (right) Anna and Rupert Murdoch, 1970

props.synopsis: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch loaned his Rolls Royce to his deputy. It led to a terrible case of mistaken identity that would change the course of two families' lives.

title.children: How the Murdoch family escaped a dark fate after case of mistaken identity

image.altText: Tyrese Haspil in a white jumpsuit and blue face mask, surrounded by five men in suits.

props.synopsis: A personal assistant convicted of killing and dismembering his former tech entrepreneur boss after stealing about $US400,000 from him is sentenced to 40 years to life.

title.children: Personal assistant convicted of killing tech entrepreneur Fahim Saleh sentenced to 40 years to life

image.altText: A beluga whale being fed fish from a boat.

props.synopsis: Hvaldimir, who rose to fame in 2019 for his friendly antics, was found dead on August 31 by fishermen who dragged his body ashore to Risavika Port.

title.children: No indication that Russian 'spy whale' Hvaldimir was shot in Norway, local police say

image.altText: An aerial view of the green river, with footpaths on either side.

props.synopsis: The state's environmental authority attributes the Pinheiros River's new green hue to an algae bloom, the result of severe drought that has significantly lowered water levels.

title.children: 'What the hell is happening?' São Paulo river turns emerald green amid fires and drought

image.altText: Tom Craig after being released from police custody in Paris.

props.synopsis: Hockey Australia has hit Olympian Tom Craig with a 12-month suspension after his arrest for attempting to purchase drugs in Paris during the 2024 Olympic Games.

title.children: 12-month ban for Kookaburra player after Paris drugs arrest

image.altText: Genetic Testing

props.synopsis: Life insurers and those offering income protection and permanent disability insurance will be banned from using genetic testing to refuse cover after a government crackdown.

title.children: Genetic testing to be banned from life insurance, income protection, disability cover

image.altText: A group of young children play, jumping with their hands in the air looking like they are ready to catch a ball.

props.synopsis: This community thinks it has found a solution to stop the toxic relationship between teenagers and social media, but is it that simple? And what do the kids think?

title.children: 'Can't just hope for the best': Hundreds of parents make 'phone pledge' to keep kids off social media

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Kristian White is set face trial in NSW Supreme Court on one count of manslaughter after the death of 95-year-old Clare Nowland.

title.children: NSW Police officer pushes for judge-alone trial over nursing home taser death

image.altText: A woman and man stand against the exterior brick wall of a house.

props.synopsis: The smallest of things would start the abuse, like being asked to take out the bins. It was enough to send Todd into a rage. Not anymore.

title.children: 'Yelling; shouting, intimidation': These men abused their partners. They're now fighting to be better

image.altText: A man and woman smiling

props.synopsis: The Australian Paralympic team is being welcomed home at Sydney Airport after winning 63 medals at the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games.

title.children: Paralympians return to Sydney with 63 medals in tow

image.altText: A breaker in Australian kit busts a move at the Olympics

props.synopsis: After a performance at the Paris Olympics that sparked global criticism, Australian breaker Raygun is currently ranked number one in the world, sparking the sport's governing body to explain why.

title.children: Raygun is currently ranked the number one breaker in the world, sparking the sport's governing body to explain why

image.altText: Jason McCartney bumps Tom Papley with his chest

props.synopsis: The AFL issued Giants football boss Jason McCartney a $20,000 fine for his clash with player Tom Papley, but Paul Roos believes that alone isn't enough of a deterrent.

title.children: 'Twenty grand is irrelevant': AFL great slams cash sanction over McCartney-Papley clash, backs ban instead

image.altText: Two rivers meeting to form one.

props.synopsis: Independent testing finds high levels of unwanted substances in a western NSW river after residents report finding fish covered in sores, but the council says the treated water is safe to drink.

title.children: Water testing finds metals and pesticides in river that thousands drink from

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair, and wearing a sleeveless top, smiles for the camera in a head-and-shoulders photo.

props.synopsis: Bradley Bell is accused of being a party to the murder of Kelly Wilkinson by her estranged husband, Brian Johnston.

title.children: Man who murdered Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson denies telling co-accused he planned to kill her

image.altText: An aerial shot of coastline with a long wharf extending out.

props.synopsis: The nation's largest solar salt project has marked a major milestone in what has been a challenging road through planning stages.

title.children: Australia's largest salt project wins government approval in WA's north
